title: ABR Model
description: The canonical model for Artifact-Based Rendering operations - the 'state' which is changeable by the user

version.description: Version of the model (semantic version, update this when updating the model)

schemaID.description: Version of the spec this model was created with

impressions.description: The data impressions that a user has created

scene.description: Any additional info about the scene (lights, camera, transforms, etc.)

uiData.description: Any additional info about user interfaces (artist UI, legend UI, physician UI, ...)

localVisAssets.description: VisAssets that are specific to this state

gradients.description: Gradients of VisAssets that are stored in the state

impressionType.description: What type of data impression is it? (one of the plate types specified in the spec)

uuid.description: The unique identifier for this data impression

name.description: User-defined name of the data impression (i.e. 'blue ocean')

visible.description: Is the layer visible in the rendering engine?

inputValues.description: Input values for this data impression (i.e. Key Data, Colormap, Color Variable, etc.)

InputValue.description: A single input value for a data impression

inputType.description: The type of this input (corresponds to a type in the ABR spec)

inputValue.description: UUID or resolvable path where the input can be found

LocalVisAsset.description: A vis asset stored locally in this state (one that has been modified by the user in ABR)

files.description: Files that are included with this VisAsset (should be small, e.g. colormap.xml)

fileContents.description: Contents of any files that are stored in this LocalVisAsset

gradientScale.description: Is it a continuous or discrete gradient?

gradientType.description: What are the elements of this gradient? (colormap, glyphs, ...)

points.description: The floating point 'stops' in the gradient. Must be the same length as `visAssets`

visAssets.description: The UUIDs of the VisAssets in the gradient. Must be the same length as `points`

DataPath.$comment: Update whenever a new data source is added to the data server. Eventually should pull this bit of schema from the data server.

Primitive.$comment: This probably should be replaced with something more useful like a regex for percentages, lengths, etc.
